page.title: 17WHIPPET COACHES,FENSTANTON
page.content: {The garage is on the A604 {Huntingdon side of Fenstanton.}It opened in Gravely in 1919.Some trips they made were{Gravely to St Neots and {St Ives.}When the first bus was made the top was pulled off and it was made bigger.It had 14 seats and the fare was 5p.{Finishing at Gravely they {moved to Hilton and Fenstanton where {they are today.} { Now coaches are bigger and some are double deckers.There are{40 vehicles-{22 coaches and 18 double {deckers.}Whippet have to pay a lot to keep coaches running.A coach costs {Â£78,000}and diesel{64p}a mile.The newest coach is a{'GO WHIPPET'}with seat belts and new wheels.Drivers earn {Â£100 TO Â£130 a week.}Coaches travel to{ Europe}and there is a regular service to {London.} { { }
